title: rustc panics when working with regexes and closures

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code

```Rust
use regex; // 1.7.3

fn main() {
    let x = regex::Regex::new("hello|world").unwrap().replace_all(
        "good morning, hello world to you.",
        |m: regex::Captures<'_>| {
            if &m[0] == "hello" {
                "bye"
            } else {
                "earth"
            }
        },
    );

    println!("{x}");
}
```

[Playground link](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=558d0c023213ff3adba9c137530458d8)

The same code but with `regex::Captures` instead of `regex::Captures<'_>` also panicked:

```Rust
use regex; // 1.7.3

fn main() {
    let x = regex::Regex::new("hello|world").unwrap().replace_all(
        "good morning, hello world to you.",
        |m: regex::Captures| {
            if &m[0] == "hello" {
                "bye"
            } else {
                "earth"
            }
        },
    );

    println!("{x}");
}
```


### Meta
No panic if I switch to nightly in the playground


### Error output

```

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md

note: rustc 1.68.2 (9eb3afe9e 2023-03-27) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: compiler flags: --crate-type bin -C embed-bitcode=no -C codegen-units=1 -C debuginfo=2

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

query stack during panic:
#0 [typeck] type-checking `main`

end of query stack
error: could not compile `playground`
```
